author: Janelle Walker
title: Cops: Men take cell phone from pedestrian, return for phone's passcode Elgin Courier-News
text:
Two men were charged with theft after they threatened a pedestrian and got him to hand over a small amount of cash and a cell phone, Elgin police said.
Roberto Salgado, 20, of the 800 block of Bode Road, Elgin, was charged with a Class 3 felony count of theft and misdemeanor charges of street gang contact by a felon and driving on a suspended license. Chris Sanchez-Baeza, 20, of the 1600 block of Evergreen Avenue, Hanover Park, was charged with a Class 3 felony count of theft.
According to police, a victim waived down an officer at about 12:30 a.m. Wednesday. The victim told police he was walking on Grand Boulevard when a car drove up and those inside demanded cash and his cell phone. Afraid that he would be hurt, the victim handed over the phone and a small amount of cash before waiving down the officer, police said.
According to reports, police stopped the vehicle nearby. Baeza said they turned back to the scene to demand the cell phone's passcode, police said.
Bail was set at $30,000 for Salgado and $10,000 for Baeza. They were given November court dates.
